definition: to get out of bed/to get up

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
grumpiness associated with poor sleep/irritability in the morning

sentences.english: Who make you mushroom so late, the whole ruddy blood temple you this hour equitable obtain up.
sentences.chinese: 谁让你起得这么晚，整个赤血宫就你这个时辰才起床。

sentences.english: Getting up at 6 a. m. to watch the sun rise over Mei Li Snow Mountain was worth it.
sentences.chinese: 早上六点就起床去梅里雪山看日出是值得的。

sentences.english: It was 14:00 when I got up today.
sentences.chinese: 今天当我起床时已经是14点。

sentences.english: When Gaston arose in the morning, his wife had already departed.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上加斯顿起床的时候，他的妻子已经离开了。

sentences.english: To support the children, Granny gets up early every day to work on her farm.
sentences.chinese: 为了扶养孙儿，阿嬷每天一大早起床到农场工作。

sentences.english: Hey,my sweetheart,time to get up for school.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，宝贝儿，该起床上学了。

sentences.english: Every morning I get up at seven I do some exercise and have a light breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早上七点钟起床，锻炼一下身体，然后吃早饭。

sentences.english: Me levanto a las ocho menos cuarto .
Yesterday morning Yang Cheng got up early, so that she caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 昨天早上杨成起床很早，因此，她赶上了早班车。

sentences.english: Every morning he gets up very early to work and gets home late.
sentences.chinese: 天天早上他都是很夙起床往上班，很晚才回家。

sentences.english: This time Old Xu couldn't even get up to open his door.
sentences.chinese: 这次老许甚至没法起床开门了。

sentences.english: I got up late this morning and went to school without feeding my cats.
sentences.chinese: 我早上起床晚了，所以没来得及喂猫就上学去了。

sentences.english: Hurry up. Get up and start to work.
Get it checked out. Maybe the reason you're waking up drowsy is health-related.
sentences.chinese: 你起床时昏昏欲睡的原因或许和健康有关。

sentences.english: He gets up in the morning, takes his readings, and continues his day.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨起床之后读取数据一次，并开始新的一天。

sentences.english: This morning I got up drank some unboiled water.
sentences.chinese: 这个早上我起床喝了些生水。

definition: to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
to wash the face and rinse the mouth
to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
midnight/in the middle of the night
